title: Anne Boden, Starling CEO, on how she went from banker to fintech entrepreneur in midlife
text:
When Anne Boden sat with an adviser at a high street bank in Maidenhead, opening an account to pay staff at her fledgling business – a brand new bank – he didn’t bat an eyelid. “If I’d said I wanted to start a new country I think he’d have just typed it in,” she laughs. “It was all dull routine and endless bureaucracy.”

In other words, it was just the kind of box-ticking bank she was setting out to challenge. Five years later, Starling Bank, Boden’s mobile-only start-up now has more than 850,000 customers. Earlier this year it won £100m of investment from RBS to expand its SME (small and medium-sized enterprise) banking and has been named Best Bank at the British Banking Awards two years running. ...
description: When Anne Boden sat with an adviser at a high street bank in Maidenhead, opening an account to pay staff at her fledgling business – a brand new bank – he didn’t bat an eyelid.
